(40) 386.September 24, 1940./TO BE KEPT UNDER LOCK AND KEY.It is requested that special care may be taken toensure the secrecy of this document.WAR CABINET.DIVERSION OF BRITISH RESOURCES FROM THE DEFENCEOF BRITAIN.EVERYTHING should be centred on the defence of Britain. All available supplies and material, all resources of every sort, including man-power, shouldbe retained here.2. If the Germans fail to attack Great Britain, that is a victory. If theGermans attack and are burled back, that is a decisive victory. If we canprevail until the winter months, the Americans will come into the war and theissue will be settled in our favour.3. For these reasons, I oppose any diversion of any resources whatsoeverfor any purpose other than the defence of Britain.4. And I hold that all our resources should be used forthwith, even at theexpense of our programme in the future.Memorandum by the Minister of Aircraft Production.B.Ministry of A aircraft Production, S. W. 1September 24, 1940.[21768]
